Web Security

How would you advise a potential client to secure his/her website from web security attacks? Note: the word count for your answer should not be greater than 250 words

To best secure your website of potential security threats, theres several methods helping websites protect from security attacks. Here are some of the most common and most advisable methods of securing your website: To ensure that the data a system accepts is in the right format, its advised to to do by either manually, or by using a third party, to sanitize the html code before its getting fed into the system. Its important to make sure that the authorization- and authentication process is difficult to crack open. A multi-factor authentication will add an extra layer of security for your website. This is something that can either be done manually, but its advised to use a open-standard authorization protocol or framework. Its important to do proper research on any third-party apps before putting it to use, an easy way to check is also to see how many weekly downloads the apps has pr week. By using a automatic process of Continuous Deployment/Continuous Integration for integrating and delivering code to production, youâ€™ll easily be able to see any changes that does not pass the checks by the system rejecting and/or redflagging them, by being rejected or redflagged it will be sent back for rework. There are several tools for CD/CI processes. Get your backend team to set a session expiration time for each and every user, ensuring they will be automatically logged after a certain time. To maintain network security, hiring an professional network engineer would be a safe option to go for.
